body:
Comment 10 by **tarmigan**: 
Alex,

Thanks so much for looking into this.

I was really curious about my mistake, so I kept working on it to make it closer to your
code.

The problem was in my use of WaitCommEvent and the scope of "events".  The "events"
DWORD whose address gets passed to WaitCommEvent needs to exist until the
GetOverLappedResults returns.  I could post my updated code, but yours is cleaner anyway.

For what it's worth, you'd have my vote for a serial package.  In my mind, a serial port
is a lot like a network port and go is a great language for low level binary
communications that often happen over serial ports.

Please close this bug.

Thanks,
Tarmigan
